title: Aroha
creator_contributor_role: New Zealand National Film Unit, production company
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Maori (New Zealand people)
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Maori (New Zealand people) - Social life and customs
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Maori (New Zealand People) - Social conditions
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/New Zealand - Race relations
description: Through the story of Aroha, daughter of a Maori chieftan, we see how the Maori people of New Zealand are integrating their ancient tribal customs with the ways of their non-Maori neighbours and progressing toward a fuller equality as citizens of New Zealand. Aroha, a student of Wellington University, is able to bring her people to a greater acceptance of the non-Maori's ways when her father is brought back to health in a modern hospital. Depicts Maori customs and concludes with tribal dances. No other credits available.
